title: Plans for PartitionExplainer
body:
Hi,

When using PartitionExplainer, I get the following warning:
`explainers.Partition is still in an alpha state, so use with caution...`
Are there any plans for further development of this explainer?

And is it possible to limit the computation of Owen values only to some level of the clustering dendrogram? I don't need to know the impact of all single features used in a model, I'm only interested in total credits assigned to specific groups. On the example from here: https://shap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/example_notebooks/tabular_examples/model_agnostic/Simple%20Boston%20Demo.html, complete clustering looks like this:
![obraz](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32520597/108356137-0aa8fe80-71ec-11eb-9867-d80d1968e0fc.png)
But suppose I'd like to cut this tree:
![obraz](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32520597/108356322-4cd24000-71ec-11eb-9f75-c4b8f139a998.png)
and compute the Owen values for these 5 coalitions. As I understand (please correct me if I'm wrong), credits are computed recursively starting from the top of dendrogram and moving downward. So is there a way to stop the algorithm at selected level and obtain values for coalitions rather than particular features, in order to decrease the time of computations?
